revised_title: Tidal Observations and Phenomena in the Indian Seas
tldr: This article presents the results of tide observations made in various locations in the Indian Seas, including Coringa Bay, Cochin, Coringa River, Surat Roads, and Bassadore. The author examines the establishment of each place and the semimenstrual inequality, as well as the diurnal inequality of heights and times. The author discovers a large diurnal inequality of the times at Bassadore, amounting to over two hours in some instances, which is a new and curious tidal feature.
